title: Docs: Update README & API
description:
Update project documentation for v2.0 release.

## README.md Updates

### Project Overview
- Update description for v2.0 features
- Add screenshots of new Kanban
- Mobile-responsive badges
- Vercel deployment info

### Features Section
- Drag-drop Kanban board
- Task detail modal
- Status tracking
- Priority management
- Agent assignment
- Mobile-optimized

### Getting Started
- Update installation instructions
- Environment variables (KV config)
- Development server setup

### API Documentation
- Task CRUD endpoints
- Activity logging endpoints
- SSE stream endpoint
- Session tracking endpoints

## API.md (Create)

### Endpoints
```
GET    /api/tracker/tasks           - List all tasks
GET    /api/tracker/tasks/[id]      - Get single task
POST   /api/tracker/tasks           - Create task
PATCH  /api/tracker/tasks/[id]      - Update task
DELETE /api/tracker/tasks/[id]      - Delete task

GET    /api/events/stream           - SSE stream
POST   /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/activities - Log activity
POST   /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions    - Agent session
```

### Request/Response Examples
- Full TypeScript interfaces
- Curl examples
- Error codes

## docs/ARCHITECTURE.md (Create)

### Data Flow
- KV → API → React → UI
- SSE broadcast flow
- Session management flow

### Component Hierarchy
- AtlasLayout
  - ObjectivesView
    - KanbanBoard
      - KanbanColumn
        - TaskCard
  - TaskModal

### Storage Schema
- Task structure
- Activity structure
- Session structure
- Deliverable structure

## docs/DEPLOYMENT.md (Create)

### Vercel Deployment
- Environment variables
- KV binding setup
- Build configuration

### Local Development
- KV emulator setup
- Testing against production KV

## Success Criteria
- README reflects v2.0 features
- API docs complete with examples
- Architecture diagram included
- Deployment guide works end-to-end

**Linus-style: No commit until tests pass**

3. Verify response has 'tasks' array
4. Verify each task has required fields: id, title, status, priority

- Verify no console errors
- Verify network response is 200

- No console errors in agent-browser
- npm run build passes

title: Stacean v2.0: Complete Polish
description:
Master epic for completing Stacean v2.0 production deployment.

## Scope
Complete mobile optimization, activity logging, real-time updates, sub-agent tracking, deliverables, and end-to-end testing.

## Deliverables
- Mobile-optimized Kanban with tap → modal → status workflow
- Full activity logging in KV
- Real-time updates via SSE
- Sub-agent session tracking per task
- Deliverable management (files/URLs)
- E2E testing passing
- Production deployment ready

## Timeline
Target: Complete by 2026-02-05

title: Real-time: SSE Implementation
Write integration tests
description: Create e2e tests for task tracker API endpoints

title: Sub-agents: Session Tracking
description:
Track which agents work on which tasks.

## Use Case
- User wants to know which agents worked on a task
- Show current active agents on task
- Agent handoff history
- Time tracking per agent

## Schema

### Agent Session
```typescript
interface AgentSession {
  id: string;
  taskId: string;
  agentId: string;
  agentName: string;
  sessionId: string; // OpenClaw session ID
  startedAt: string;
  endedAt?: string;
  status: 'active' | 'idle' | 'completed' | 'failed';
  workSummary?: string;
}
```

### Task Extension
```typescript
interface TaskWithSessions extends Task {
  sessions: AgentSession[];
  activeSessions: AgentSession[];
  lastActiveAgent?: string;
}
```

## Implementation

### 1. KV Storage
- Store sessions in task.sessions array
- Limit to last 20 sessions per task
- Track current active sessions separately

### 2. API Endpoints
- POST /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions - Agent claims task
- PATCH /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions/[sessionId] - Update session
- GET /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions - Get session history

### 3. OpenClaw Integration
- Agent calls /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions on startWork()
- Agent updates session.status on progress
- Agent calls /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/sessions/[sessionId] on endWork()

### 4. UI Display
- TaskModal Sub-agents tab shows session history
- Active sessions highlighted
- Show duration per session
- Quick link to agent session logs

## Success Criteria
- Agent work history visible per task
- Active agents shown in TaskModal
- Session times tracked accurately
- Performance: <100ms to load session list

title: Testing: E2E & Polish
description:
End-to-end testing and final polish before production.

## Testing Checklist

### Desktop (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- [ ] Drag task from TODO to ASSIGNED
- [ ] Drag task to NEEDS YOU
- [ ] Open TaskModal → change status → save
- [ ] Open TaskModal → change priority → save
- [ ] Edit task description → save
- [ ] Reorder tasks within column
- [ ] Concurrent edits (2 tabs open)
- [ ] Page refresh after edit → data persists
- [ ] Empty state (no tasks in column)
- [ ] Keyboard navigation (tab, enter, escape)

### Mobile (iPhone Safari, Android Chrome, iPad)
- [ ] Tap task card → TaskModal opens
- [ ] Change status via dropdown → save
- [ ] Column collapse/expand works
- [ ] Vertical scrolling through columns
- [ ] Quick jump to column works
- [ ] Page refresh → data persists
- [ ] Touch targets are 44px minimum

### KV Sync (Vercel)
- [ ] Make task change on local dev
- [ ] Push to Vercel
- [ ] Verify change appears on live site
- [ ] Check auto-sync latency

### Error Handling
- [ ] Network failure → error message shown
- [ ] API timeout → retry or error
- [ ] Invalid task ID → graceful error
- [ ] Session expired → redirect to login

## Polish Checklist

### Performance
- [ ] Bundle size < 200KB (next-bundle-analyzer)
- [ ] Lighthouse Performance score > 90
- [ ] First Contentful Paint < 1.5s
- [ ] Time to Interactive < 3s

### Accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA)
- [ ] Color contrast > 4.5:1
- [ ] All interactive elements keyboard accessible
- [ ] ARIA labels on icon-only buttons
- [ ] Focus indicators visible
- [ ] Screen reader tests (NVDA, VoiceOver)

### UX Polish
- [ ] Loading spinners on all async ops
- [ ] Success toast on save
- [ ] Error messages are clear and actionable
- [ ] Empty states have helpful text
- [ ] Hover states on all interactive elements
- [ ] Active states on mobile tap

### Code Quality
- [ ] No TypeScript errors
- [ ] No ESLint warnings
- [ ] All props properly typed
- [ ] Error boundaries for components
- [ ] Consistent formatting (Prettier)

## Success Criteria
- All desktop tests pass
- All mobile tests pass
- KV sync verified
- Performance > 90 Lighthouse
- Accessibility AA compliant
- Ready for production merge

title: Test P5: Full workflow - beads-sync create → KV → Stacean UI
description:
**LINUS-STYLE: NOTHING IS DONE UNTIL FRONTEND E2E TESTS PASS**

**Context:**
- Jordan: "I cannot think of being complete until the frontend passes agent browser skill tests at the end of it."
- This is THE critical gate - nothing else matters until this passes

**Final E2E Test (MUST PASS before closing ANY Phase 5 bead):**

1. **Create test tasks from multiple repos:**
   - beads-sync create "Test from clawd" -p 3 (from clawd repo)
   - beads-sync create "Test from stacean" -p 3 (from stacean repo)

2. **Agent-Browser Test (CRITICAL):**
   - Navigate to Stacean URL
   - Open browser console (MUST show NO errors)
   - Take screenshot of full Kanban
   - Verify BOTH tasks appear
   - Filter by "clawd", screenshot, verify filtering
   - Filter by "stacean-repo", screenshot, verify filtering
   - Filter by "All Projects", screenshot, verify both visible

3. **TaskModal Test:**
   - Click each task, verify opens
   - Verify project field shows correct project
   - Close modal, no console errors

4. **Final Verification:**
   - Screenshot showing both tasks from different repos
   - Screenshot showing project filter working
   - Console showing no JavaScript errors

**Quality Gate (ALL REQUIRED):**
- npm run build passes
- agent-browser console shows NO errors
- Both tasks visible in Stacean
- Project filtering works correctly
- TaskModal opens without errors

**If ANY test fails:**
- Do NOT close any bead
- Fix the issue
- Re-run ALL tests
- Only when ALL tests pass → Close all Phase 5 beads

**This is THE gate. Nothing is done until this passes.**
close_reason: Closed

title: Real-time Updates - SSE/Polling
description:
Implement real-time task updates without page refresh.

Options:
1. Polling refinement: Optimize 5s poll with smarter delta detection
2. SSE: Server-Sent Events for true real-time updates

If SSE:
- Create /api/events/stream endpoint
- Broadcast task updates via SSE
- Client subscribes to task changes
- Handle connection cleanup on page unload

Current: 5s polling works but causes UI jumps. Consider SSE for scale.
notes: Parent: clawd-bnq (Stacean v2.0: Polish & Production Ready)

title: Activity Logging API
description: Create /api/tasks/[id]/activities endpoint for audit trail

title: Deliverables: File & URL Tracking
description:
Track deliverables (files, URLs, artifacts) per task.

## Use Case
- Agent uploads code file as deliverable
- User adds PR URL as deliverable
- Track screenshots, docs, binaries
- Quick access to all task outputs

## Schema

### Deliverable
```typescript
interface Deliverable {
  id: string;
  type: 'file' | 'url' | 'artifact';
  title: string;
  description?: string;
  path?: string; // For files: Vercel blob path
  url?: string; // For URLs: external link
  size?: number; // File size in bytes
  mimeType?: string; // file/png, application/pdf
  createdAt: string;
  createdBy?: string; // agent name or user
}
```

### Task Extension
```typescript
interface TaskWithDeliverables extends Task {
  deliverables: Deliverable[];
  deliverableCount: number;
}
```

## Implementation

### 1. File Upload (Vercel Blob)
- Use Vercel Blob storage for files
- Upload API: POST /api/upload
- Returns blob URL
- Store Deliverable in task.deliverables

### 2. URL Deliverables
- Manual URL input in TaskModal
- Validate URL format
- Store directly in task.deliverables

### 3. UI Components
- DeliverableList component
- FileUploader component (drag-drop upload)
- URLInput component
- DeliverableCard with preview icon

### 4. File Types
- Images: show thumbnail preview
- Code: show file icon, syntax highlight if .ts/.js
- Docs: show PDF/doc icon
- URLs: show link preview

## Success Criteria
- Users can upload files to tasks
- URLs can be added as deliverables
- Files stored in Vercel Blob
- Deliverables visible in TaskModal
- File preview for images

title: Test P3: Project dropdown visible and filters
Activity Logging - KV Storage
description:
Store task activity history in KV task metadata.

Implementation:
- Extend task metadata with activities array
- Log status changes, priority updates, comments
- Create activity structure: { type, message, timestamp, actor }
- Store in task.activities field in KV
- Display in TaskModal Activity tab
- Filter by activity type (created, assigned, status_changed, comment)

title: Mobile: Touch-Optimized Task Cards
description:
Implement touch-friendly task management for mobile devices.

## Problem
@hello-pangea/dnd drag-drop doesn't work well on mobile touchscreens. Tasks are hard to move on phones.

## Solution
Tap-based workflow: tap task card → open TaskModal → select status from dropdown.

## Implementation

### 1. Touch Detection
```typescript
const isTouchDevice = window.matchMedia('(hover: none)').matches;
```

### 2. TaskCard Handler
- Add onClick handler to TaskCard
- Check isTouchDevice before opening modal
- Keep drag-drop for desktop

### 3. TaskModal Enhancement
- Status dropdown should be prominent on mobile
- Consider adding 'Quick Actions' row at bottom
- Save button always visible on mobile

### 4. Visual Feedback
- Add active state to TaskCard on tap
- Small scale animation on press
- Haptic feedback (if available)

## Testing
- Test on iPhone Safari
- Test on Android Chrome
- Test on iPad (touch vs hover)
- Test desktop (ensure drag-drop still works)

## Success Criteria
- Users can easily change task status on mobile
- Desktop drag-drop remains functional
- No performance degradation on desktop

title: Activity: KV Storage Schema
description:
Design and implement activity logging schema in KV task metadata.

## Schema Design

### Activity Entry
```typescript
interface Activity {
  id: string;
  type: ActivityType;
  message: string;
  actor?: string; // agent name or user
  timestamp: string;
  metadata?: Record<string, any>;
}

type ActivityType = 
  | 'created'      // Task created
  | 'assigned'      // Agent assigned
  | 'status_changed' // Status changed
  | 'priority_changed' // Priority changed
  | 'comment'       // Comment added
  | 'file_created'  // File deliverable added
  | 'completed'     // Task completed/shipped
  | 'deleted';      // Task soft-deleted
```

### Task Metadata Extension
```typescript
interface TaskWithActivities extends Task {
  activities: Activity[];
  activityCount: number;
  lastActivity?: string;
}
```

## Implementation

### 1. KV Storage
- Store activities array in task.metadata.activities
- Update task.activities on every status change
- Limit to last 100 activities per task (prevent bloat)

### 2. API Updates
- PATCH /api/tracker/tasks/[id] - auto-log activity
- POST /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/activities - manual activity
- GET /api/tracker/tasks/[id]/activities - fetch history

### 3. Frontend Display
- TaskModal Activity tab shows timeline
- Group by day
- Show activity type icons
- Filter by type selector

## Success Criteria
- All task changes are logged
- Activity history visible in TaskModal
- Activities persist in KV
- Performance: <100ms to load last 50 activities
